channel.title: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?
channel.description:
where do i edit the source and client so that its able to get online? ive got no-ip duc, and my postforward is able to connect.
a 508 source and client

item.title: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:8, topic:413022”][quote author=jwags link=topic=514495.msg3735040#msg3735040 date=1314896417]

Client class, search for 127.0.0.1 or localhost, change that to your ip.

it could also be 0.0.0.0, or the person who created it, it could be their ip. thats why i didnt say the local host ip
[/quote]
IT’S THE SAME![/quote]
this.
they’re all smart asses

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?

item.source: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?

item.title: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

you only need to edit the ip in the client side, u don’t really need to edit it in the source side. go to egui, gui, or something that is similar to that file name in client folder, and near the bottom you will see some ip, it might be example.no-ip.org or something like that or even ###.###.#.# idk what ever it is replace it with your no-ip thing, but copy that ip address, now find it in your clients client.java file and replace that ip with yours, search a couple times, it might be there a few times. if u want u can check your client.java file in your source folder just in case. sometimes its in there.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?

item.title: Need some help on where to edit the ip's inside the source and client?
item.dc:creator: @fasthop10 fasthop10
item.description:
@fasthop10 wrote:

please specify what source you are useing as for the client look in the client.java file and if you know the ip its currently connecting to search for that if not search for the word server

and you shoudl fine something a few times down liek this

it may not look exatly liek that so dont search that thats just off my memory

the ip doesnt need editing server sided , but if explane your problems a littel better and ill do my best to give you help

Read full topic
